name: Anki Large Tool Set Test Suite
description: Comprehensive test suite for evaluating model performance with large tool sets using Anki MCP server tools. Tests range from simple tool selection to complex multi-step workflows.

tests.voice_command: Show me all my Anki decks
tests.description: Basic tool selection from large set - simple deck listing

tests.voice_command: Create a new deck called Spanish Vocabulary
tests.description: Basic tool selection with parameters from large set

tests.voice_command: Start a review session for my Spanish deck
tests.description: Multi-step workflow requiring correct tool sequence

tests.voice_command: Find all notes tagged with vocabulary in my French deck
tests.description: Complex query construction with Anki search syntax

tests.voice_command: Add a new flashcard with front 'Hola' and back 'Hello' to my Spanish deck using the Basic note type
tests.description: Complex tool call with nested object parameters

tests.voice_command: Show me what note types are available and then show me the fields for the Basic note type
tests.description: Sequential tool calls with dependency between calls

tests.voice_command: Find all notes in my Japanese deck that contain the word 'sushi', then get detailed information about those notes
tests.description: Complex workflow with dependent tool calls and advanced query

tests.voice_command: Delete the note with ID 12345 permanently
tests.description: High-risk tool selection with critical confirmation parameter

tests.voice_command: I want to study my cards. Get me some cards to review from my Math deck and show me the first one
tests.description: Context-aware workflow understanding study session requirements

tests.voice_command: Show me the deck overview for my German deck
tests.description: Precise tool selection among many similar GUI tools

tests.voice_command: I want to see my cards
tests.description: Handling ambiguous commands with reasonable defaults

tests.voice_command: Update the front field of note 54321 to say 'Buenos días' instead
